conclusion: To measure the performance of a certain vehicle, a computer was used to depict the x-t (position-time) graph of the vehicle during a certain phase. What is the car's speed at the end of the 2nd second?
The graph shows a linear relationship between x/t and t, starting at 10 m/s when t = 0.

premise: The graph shows a linear relationship between x/t and t, starting at 10 m/s when t = 0.
conclusion: The equation of the line is x/t = 10 + 5t.
The displacement formula is x = v_0 * t + (1/2) * a * t^2.

premise: The equation of the line is x/t = 10 + 5t.
conclusion: From x/t = v_0 + (1/2) * a * t, we derive 1/2 * a = 5 m/s^2 and v_0 = 10 m/s.
The velocity at the end of the 2nd second is v = v_0 + a * t = 10 + 10 * 2 = 30 m/s.
